data.title: Parking at Delhi Metro in 2021
data.meta_description: Check out the metro parking charges at Delhi, along with the name of the stations which provide parking facilities.
data.text:
Is Parking Space available in Delhi Metro Station?

Delhi Metro is the lifeline of the country’s capital. Every day, millions of people in New Delhi and adjacent satellite towns of Noida, Ghaziabad, and Gurgaon, rely on the Metro facilities for their daily commute. That, however, isn’t without its limitations. Even though the metro network is extensive, a lot of people have to travel a significant distance to reach the nearest metro station. A lot of people choose to drive themselves to a metro station, which means they need a parking space for their vehicle before taking a metro.

Parking in big metropolitan cities is a pain, no matter which place it is. Car parking near New Delhi railway station is an especially problematic situation. Improper parking causes obstruction to traffic, inconvenience to other road users, and attracts fines. Not only that, Delhi is notorious for thefts, and leaving your car by the side of the road is almost an invitation for thieves. Thankfully, there is parking facility available in numerous Delhi metro stations. Here, we’ll tell you everything you need to know about Delhi Metro parking, including metro parking charges for 2021, which stations provide parking, and parking fines.

Parking Charges At Delhi Metro Stations in 2021

Is Parking free at Metro Station in Delhi?

Parking at Delhi Metro Stations is not free because it is managed by 3rd party contractors. The rates are uniform across all stations and are fixed by DMRC. It used to be Rs.20 - Rs.40 for cars, depending on the duration.

2- Wheeler Parking Fees at Metro Station in Delhi

Delhi Metro provides parking facilities for bicycles, motorcycles, scooters, and non-commercial four-wheelers. Cycle parking at Delhi Metro Stations is especially cheap, costing just Rs. 5 for a time period for less than 6 hours, Rs. 5 for between 6 to 12 hours, and Rs. 10 for up to 24 hours. If you wish to leave your cycle parked for the night, it’ll only cost you Rs. 10. If you are a regular commuter, you can also opt for a monthly pass, which will cost just Rs. 70.

Motorcycle and scooter parking at Delhi Metro Stations is significantly more expensive. For under 6 hours, the parking charges are Rs. 15. Between 6 to 12 hours, you’ll have to pay Rs. 25, while it costs Rs. 30 for up to 24 hours. Night-time parking fee is Rs. 30 as well. For a monthly pass, you’ll have to pay Rs. 600.

Car Parking Costs at Metro Station in Delhi

As for car parking at Delhi Metro Stations, it costs nearly twice as much as for 2-wheeler. The charge for less than 6 hours is Rs. 30, Rs. 50 for up to 12 hours, and Rs. 60 for up to 24 hours. Night parking charges are Rs. 60, and monthly parking charge is Rs. 1200.

Note: You’re not allowed to leave your car in a metro parking facility for more than 48 hours. Even with a monthly pass, you’ll have to pick your car up after 48 hours (With the exception of . Upon failing to do so, DMRC will tow the car away for scrapping. To get the car back, you’ll have to pay a fine of Rs. 500, along with the towing charges incurred and cost of parking for the duration.

Which Delhi Metro Stations Have Parking Facility?

Even though parking facilities at Delhi Metro seem like a necessity at this point, DMRC hasn’t built parking areas for every metro station. Still, there are plenty of stations that do. Here is a list of all the stations that have parking facilities along with how big the parking area is, segregated according to the different metro-lines.

Parking Facility At Red Line Metro Stations

Parking Facility At Yellow Line Metro Stations

Note: This does not include: New Delhi Railway Station Premium Parking (Ajmeri Gate), New Delhi Railway Station General Parking, and New Delhi Airport Metro Station Multi Level Parking (Opposite New Delhi Railway Station). Parking charges for those are as follows-

Parking Facility At Blue Line Metro Stations

Parking Facility At Blue Line (Branch Line) Metro Stations

Parking Facility At Green Line Metro Stations

Parking Facility At Violet Line Metro Stations

Parking Facility At Pink Line Metro Stations

Is parking available at Dhaula Kuan Metro station?

Yes, it is. The nearest parking is in Dhaula Kuan Enclave I, Dhaula Kuan.

No Parking Fines at Delhi Metro Station

At the moment, DMRC does not impose “No Parking” fines for parking illegally near their premise, but the authorities concerned can call the police for such matters. If you’re parking improperly inside the premise, a security personnel will approach you and request you to park your car properly, and even guide you to a better spot.

If you decide to park illegally somewhere else, instead of parking at proper spots, you’ll have to bear heavy fines. No Parking Fines in Delhi NCR have become unbearably expensive after the implementation of Motor Vehicles [Amendment] Act. You can also check out some of our other articles about parking rules and fines in India and latest challan rates in india.

It is advisable that you search for a proper car parking in Delhi. If you aren’t using DMRC car parking, you can search for private parking facilities. There are plenty of parking spaces available in Delhi NCR near popular tourist destinations. Also, make sure you have appropriate parking at your home, or at least nearby.
